Irregular satellite name=Tarqeq - Saturn LII discoverer=[[Scott S. Sheppard]]
[[David C. Jewitt]]
[[Jan Kleyna]]
[[Brian G. Marsden]] discovery_date=April 13, 2007ref name="MPEC"ref name="IAUC8836" epoch=2007 Apr. 10.0 ref_orb_elems=ref name="MPEC" semimajor=17.9106 eccentricity=0.1081 inclination=49.90 period=894.86 d diameter=7 kmref name="MPEC" albedo=? '''Tarqeq''' (pronEngˈtɑrkeɪk ''TAR-kayk),'' also known as '''Saturn LII''' (provisional designation '''S/2007 S 1''') is a [[natural satellite]] of [[Saturn]]. Its discovery was announced by [[Scott S. Sheppard]], [[David C. Jewitt]], [[Jan Kleyna]], and [[Brian G. Marsden]] on April 13, 2007, from observations taken between January 5, 2006 and March 22, 2007.ref name="MPEC"[http://cfa-www.harvard.edu/mpec/K07/K07G38.html MPEC 2007-G38: ''S/2007 S 1''] April 13, 2007 (discovery, prediscovery and ephemeris)ref name="IAUC8836"[http://cfa-www.harvard.edu/iauc/08800/08836.html IAUC 8836: ''S/2007 S 1, S/2007 S 2, and S/2007 S 3''] May 11, 2007 (discovery) The [[semi-major axis]] of S/2007 S 1 is 17.9106 Gm and it orbits Saturn in 894.86 days. The orbit at an [[inclination]] of 49.90° (to the [[ecliptic]]; 49.77°to Saturn's equator), in a [[retrograde and direct motion|prograde]] direction and with an [[orbital eccentricity|eccentricity]] of 0.1081.ref name="MPEC" The diameter of the moon is seven kilometres.ref name="Sheppard"[http://www.dtm.ciw.edu/sheppard/satellites/satsatdata.html Saturn's Known Satellites] It is a member of the Inuit group of irregular satellites. Tarqeq is named after [[Tarquiup Inua|Tarqeq]], the [[Inuit]] [[moon god]].ref name="IAUC8873"[http://cfa-www.harvard.edu/iauc/08800/08873.html IAUC 8873: ''Satellites of Saturn''] September 20, 2007 (naming) ==References== reflist
